fter she leaves

eal chance of a

r  in her first
days; My guess is that Hydras was afraid that she would be =
an...  easy prey
for some Predacons and taking in count that he had some pl=
ans for her she

rment for

wander inside the area it was assigned as her temporary quarters=
 in a branch
of Medical bay... After Tucson was taken prisioner, it was whe=
n Hydras Let
her wander a little in base and Hydras consider to give her so=
me task that
doesnt require to leave the base, my best guess is that she wa=
s asigned to
Cyclonus as assistant in other tasks that dont require skills =
in the fine
art of intrigue... A big mistake if you asked me, If you want t=

she had chance to help in a scheme under the command of Cyclon=
us, you should
ask to Rodimus...=94Perceptor added with slight diferent ton=
e hoping that
MAximals conect the dots

<NEW>

After Perceptor finished tal=
king Santon and Bump exchanged glances, they had
obviously connected at lea=
st some of the dots that Perceptor had been
implying. Something may have ha=
ppened between Nightlight, Cyclonus and
Rodimus knew about it, or thought h=
e knew about it.

Legacy continued to work at his console, continuing in hi=
s task, to attempt
a reconstruction of Nightlight=92s spark. His hand dance=
d across the console.
=93I will question Rodimus at a later point.=94 Legac=
y said, it was obvious
that, unlike Santon and Bump, he had totally missed =
the dots that were to be
connected.

=93We shall attempt the complete reset=
 then. It is likely that this will
repair the original, since these are the=
 core algorithms that were her
personality codes.=94 Legacy said his mind s=
till on the task. =93Santon if you
will continue to monitor her condition a=
nd be prepared to initiate a
specified frequency burst on my mark, I will a=
ttempt a reset.

Santon nodded as he sat down at Nightlight=92s side. =93If=
 this doesn=92t work,
Rodimus won=92t like it.=94 He pulled out a small pro=
be and cutter. He carefully
sliced open her chest cavity. With a delicate t=
ouch he inserted a small
extendable probe, one that would reach down to her=
 spark casing and waited
on Legacy.

Over the speakers came Lord Elder=92s =
voice, =93Rodimus has left the base to
assist Tuscon.=94 Elder=92s voice wa=
s low and grim. =93Also there is some sort of
Predacon spy about. We don=92=
t know where he is. Quickstride is keeping an
optic open outside the base. =
You may want to do that in here as well.=94

=93Oh no.=94 Bump said, =93Rig=
ht now, Rodimus may be the least of our worries.=94

Legacy turned to look =
at Santon, =93Begin the process."

With a small movement Santon pressed a s=
ingle green button on the probe  . .
.

[BEEP . . . BEEP . . . BEEEEEEEEEEE=
EEEEEEEEEEPPPPPPPPPP]

The computer monitors beside Nightlight that had bee=
n monitoring her
condition began to chirp in alarm as she flat lined . . .
=
